bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Arlington and Johnson. Memo from Judge About Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Federal District of Washington Territory holding Terms at Tacoma in and for Pierce County.
The Territory of Washington vs. Timothy Johnson
To Lewis Byrd Sheriff of Pierce County.

I've command you that you have the body of Timothy Johnson by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the lenie and canel ofanch imprisonment and defensive by whatever name an aid Timothy Johnson shall be called on charged before Medtow. John P. Hoyt Judge of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory at the Court House at the City of Tacoma at said District on the 28th day of January AD 1885 at one oclock p.m. of that day ts di and were what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Timothy Johnson. And have for then and there this writ.
Witness the Hon John P Hoyt, Judge of the said district Court and the seal thereof this 27th January AD 1885
